moves.5. Nc3 Bb4: I dont think its good to exchange the bishop for the knight. such exchange will give the white the option to take control of the center by plating c4, twice.
moves.6. a3 Bxc3+ 7. bxc3 O-O 8. Bg5 h6 9. Bh4: c4 or Bd3 are also good options.
moves.11. Bd3 Nxe5 12. dxe5 Ne4 13. Bxe4 dxe4: ?! Bxe4 is leaving white with two double pawns and open space for black bishop and no double pawns for black.
moves.15. Qxd8 Qxd8 16. Bxd8 Rxd8 17. Rfd1 Rc8: Black's position is very bad now: a stupid bishop that has nowhere to go  and less material.
moves.18... c5 19. Rab1 Rc7 20. g4 Bg6 21. h4: why giving the bishop achance to move? Rd8  is much better.
black is going to take the e5 pawn and it seems that nothing can stop him...
who will stop the h pawn?
moves.32... Rd7 33. h6 g5 34. Kg3 Kg6 35. Rh1: losing another piece and the game is lost now...
